body: Indonesia welcomes US tariff cuts to boost retail, but warns zero tariffs on China goods could harm local SMEs and industry.

title: Indonesia Plans Cocoa Export Levy to Fund Sector Upgrades
body: Indonesia will impose a cocoa export levy in Q3 2025 to fund replanting and training as cocoa exports top $2.6 billion in 2024.

title: US Deal: Indonesia to Only Lift Local Content Policy for Some Sectors
body: Jakarta will only lift its local content requirement in some sectors, but does not say which American products will get that privilege.

title: Indonesia Plans to Extend Economic Stimulus into Q3
body: Indonesia plans to extend its economic stimulus into Q3 2025 to maintain momentum toward its 5.2% growth target.

title: Mining Remains Indonesia’s Economic Backbone Amid Global Uncertainty
body: Indonesia’s mining sector drives 12% of GDP in 2024, powering growth while solidifying its position in global nickel and mineral supply.

title: Indonesia to Ease Mineral Export Restriction for US, But Ore Sale Ban Remains
body: A joint statement by the White House says that Indonesia will remove restrictions on critical mineral exports.

title: BYD Bets on Budget EV Boom With Atto 1 Debut in Indonesia
body: The launch is part of BYD’s broader strategy to tap into the underserved entry-level EV segment in the region.

title: Upcoming Festival to Zero In on Indonesia’s Energy Self-Sufficiency Dream
body: The 2025 Energi dan Mineral Festival will take place in Hutan Kota by Plataran on July 30-31.

title: What’s in the New US-Indonesia Trade Agreement?
body: Indonesia will eliminate approximately 99 percent of tariff barriers for a full range of US industrial and US food and agricultural products

title: Indonesia to Exempt US Companies from Local Content Requirement
body: This local content requirement once barred Apple from selling its iPhone 16 in Indonesia.

title: Trump Says US Will Impose 19% Tariff on Philippines In Deal Struck With Marcos
body: Trump wrote that Marcos' visit was "beautiful," and it was a "Great Honor" to host such a "very good, and tough, negotiator."

title: China’s EV Surge Redefines GIIAS as Japanese Brands Play Catch-Up
body: The rise of Chinese brands coincides with Indonesia’s expanding EV market.

title: Indonesia to Release Revised Poverty Data Amid Scrutiny and Methodology Debate
body: The latest available BPS data puts Indonesia’s absolute poverty rate at 8.57 percent as of September 2024, or around 24.06 million people.

title: Indonesia Revises Budget Deficit Forecast as Revenue Falls in H1 2025
body: Indonesia posted a budget deficit of Rp 204.24 trillion ($12.5 billion) in the first half of 2025, or 0.84 percent of GDP.

title: Indonesia Draws $58 Billion in H1 Investment, Fueled by Downstream Expansion
body: This surge reflects the government’s aggressive push to ban exports of raw ore and concentrate, and to develop value-added industries.

title: Indonesia Cuts 1,000 Finance Ministry Jobs Amid Drive for Leaner Budget
body: To offset the reduction in staff, the ministry has accelerated the adoption of digital systems across multiple functions.

title: Slight US Tariff Gap with Vietnam Keeps Indonesian Businesses on Their Toes
body: The single percentage point difference in US tariffs between Indonesia and Vietnam does not mean Jakarta can rest on its laurels.

title: Indonesia-US Trade to Double to $80 Billion After Tariff Deal, Kadin Says
body: It will be a “balanced” $80 billion trade with the US, according to the Indonesian chamber of commerce Kadin.

title: Garuda in Talks to Buy 50 Boeing Jets Under US Tariff Deal
body: Garuda Indonesia is in talks with Boeing to buy 50 aircraft as part of a tariff deal with the US.

title: Indonesia Says 19 Pct Tariff Deal with Trump is Final and Binding
body: Indonesia says that it is currently drafting a joint statement with the US on the recently agreed tariff deal.

title: Indonesia’s Oil Lifting Hits 95% of Target
body: Indonesia’s oil lifting nears target as SKK Migas bets on output gains from key fields.

title: Daikin Rolls Out First Locally Made ACs from New $206M West Java Plant
body: Daikin begins mass distribution of locally made AC units from its new West Java factory, aiming for 1.5 million units annually by 2025.

title: Indonesia’s Capital Market Investors Surge 40% to 17 Million, the Largest in ASEAN
body: Indonesia’s investor base nears 17M, surpassing Thailand, Malaysia, and the Philippines as retail interest in capital markets accelerates.

title: Italy’s Eni Eyes $10 Billion Gas Investment in East Kalimantan
body: According to Eni Indonesia's website, the company started gas production at the Jangkrik field on 15 May 2017.

title: Prajogo Pangestu’s Energy Firm Dethrones BCA as IDX’s Most Valuable Company
body: BREN now holds the top spot with a market capitalization of Rp 1,070 trillion ($65.5 billion), surpassing BCA’s Rp 1,028 trillion.

title: Indonesia Launches 80,081 Rural Cooperatives to Save $6.1 Billion Annual State Loss
body: The rural cooperatives will partner with state-run enterprises in absorbing farmers' unhusked rice as Prabowo goes after food cartels.

title: Agriculture Minister: Rice in Japan Costs $6/kg, Just Under $1 in Indonesia
body: Indonesia’s rice production rose 14 percent to 21.7 million tons in the January-July period compared to the same timeframe in 2024.

title: ASEAN Happy if World’s Biggest Trade Bloc RCEP Gains New Members
body: ASEAN is open to having the RCEP bloc gain new members as the group searches for shock absorbers amid Trump's tariff war.

title: Indonesia Says Apple Vendor Will Still Invest in Batam Factory After Tariff Deal
body: The government says Apple's Chinese vendor Luxshare-ICT will remain committed to the Batam AirTag factory plan.

title: Indonesia Grants Zero Tariff to 99% of US Imports, Excluding Alcohol and Pork
body: Of the 11,552 tariff lines under Indonesia’s harmonized system (HS), approximately 11,474 have been agreed upon for tariff elimination.

title: Indonesia to Begin Energy Imports from US Following Tariff Deal, Minister Confirms
body: Under the agreement, Indonesia plans to import liquefied petroleum gas (LPG), crude oil, and refined fuel products from the United States.

title: Indonesia Pushes for Tariff Exemptions on Palm Oil, Coffee Exports to US
body: Indonesia seeks zero tariffs for key exports to the US while keeping some US goods taxed. US exports to Indonesia hit $10.2B in 2024.

title: Indonesia Unveils Strategy to Help MSMEs Survive After Granting 0% Tariff on US Goods
body: Jakarta has agreed to let American goods enter its market duty-free in exchange for a lower 19 percent tariff on US-bound Indonesian goods.

title: VinFast to Introduce New Model during Indonesia Auto Show
body: In just over a year since its official market entry in Indonesia, VinFast has expanded the dealership network to 24 showrooms.

title: Indonesia to Remain Top Palm Oil Supplier for US Thanks to Tariff Deal
body: Indonesia is set to maintain its dominance in the American palm oil market after the US sets its tariff on Jakarta at 19 percent.

title: Indonesia's $15 Billion US Energy Import Can Backfire, Analyst Warns
body: The major oil purchase deal with the US can worsen Jakarta's oil trade deficit and add pressure on government spending, analyst says.

title: Indonesian Business Leaders Applaud US Tariff Reduction Deal
body: Kadin welcomes the US tariff cut on Indonesian goods to 19%, calling it a chance to double trade despite global trade challenges.

title: US Tariffs on Indonesia Drop to 19%, Among The Lowest in Southeast Asia
body: The US will cut tariffs on Indonesian goods to 19% under a Prabowo-Trump deal, the lowest in ASEAN, giving RI an edge over Vietnam.

title: US Companies in China Report Record-Low New Investment Plans
body: The companies are also challenged by China's slowing economy, where weak domestic demand and overcapacity are eroding profitability.

title: Prabowo’s Quick Call with Trump Leads to Major Trade Breakthrough
body: “It was a serious conversation, but at the same time warm and friendly,” the Cabinet Secretariat noted.
